title: Cottage Cheese Doughnuts
description: Very easy to make, yealds 36 small one bite doughnuts.
story:
This is a recipe from my childhood, I loved these doughnuts when I was a child. I always thought that they are rather hard to make and require a lot of time and oil :). Turns out it is not true. It took me around 30 minutes to make the doughnuts and about half a liter (or a little bit less) of canola oil - the trick is to use small saucepan.
Tip for the next time: make them smaller, aim for 40 or even more out of this amount of ingredients, they would cook faster.

ingredients.name: cottage cheese
ingredients.preparationNotes: (can use Ricotta cheese, but then consider adding a bit ore flour and skip the blending step)

instructions: Add sugar, salt, vanilla, and eggs to cottage cheese and blend all together - should yeald a smooth mixed well paste.

Start adding flour, some at a time. How much flour you need will depend on how dry is the cottage cheese, I needed about 160g. I wanted to have as less as possible flour, just enuoght to handle the dough.
Work the dough, so that it would come together into a nice ball.
Divide into 35 (or more) equal pieces, make small balls.
On a stovetop pre-heat canola oil in a small saucepan to 350F (180C).
Cook in small batches, 3-6 minutes, until nice brown.
Rest on a paper towel, sprinkle with powdered sugar.
